children.text: There are gaps in the external vents where embers may enter in the event of a bushfire.
relevant Australian Standard AS 3959 Construction of Buildings in Bushfire-Prone Areas states that

‘Vents and weepholes in external walls shall be screened with a mesh with a maximum aperture of 2 mm, made of corrosion-resistant steel, bronze or aluminium, except where the vents and weepholes have an aperture less than 3 mm’ .
The builder must install these vent covers to comply with the BAL requirements for occupant safety reasons.
